info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 02 at 2:15PM CDT until April 02 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WESTERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS PANHANDLES... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MONDAY TO MIDNIGHT CDT TUESDAY NIGHT FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WESTERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS PANHANDLES... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM Monday to midnight CDT Tuesday night. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron. In Texas...Dallam... Sherman...Hansford...Hartley...Moore...Hutchinson...Oldham... Potter...Carson...Deaf Smith...Randall...Armstrong and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...Today, southwest at 15 to 25 mph. Monday, southwest at 20 to 35 mph, and Tuesday, westerly at 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 70 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 5 percent today and Monday and 8 percent on Tuesday. * Red Flag Threat Index...4 to 5 today, 4 to 7 on Monday, and 7 to 8 on Tuesday. * Timing...until 10 PM tonight. Monday 10 AM to midnight Tuesday night.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
